ocr_create_text_data.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 import cv2
2 import numpy as np
3 
4 num_dir = 0
5 samples = np.empty((0,100))
6 responses = []
7 while num_dir < 10:
8  num = 0
9  while num < 100:
10  name = '/root/catkin_ws/src/ocr/dataset/'+ str(num_dir) + '/' + str(num) + '.jpg'
11  img = cv2.imread(name, cv2.IMREAD_GRAYSCALE)
12  cv2.imshow('img',img)
13 
14  (thresh, bin_img) = cv2.threshold(img, 127, 255, cv2.THRESH_BINARY)
15  #cv2.imshow('bin_img',bin_img)
16 
17  #thresh = cv2.adaptiveThreshold(img,255,1,1,3,2)
18  #rng = cv2.inRange(img, (0, 0, 0), (100, 100, 100))
19  #cv2.imshow('rng',rng)
20  #cv2.waitKey(10)
21 
22  contours,hierarchy = cv2.findContours(bin_img,cv2.RETR_EXTERNAL,cv2.CHAIN_APPROX_SIMPLE)
23 
24  for cnt in contours:
25  if cv2.contourArea(cnt)>20:
26  [x,y,w,h] = cv2.boundingRect(cnt)
27 
28  if h>20:
29  cv2.rectangle(img,(x,y),(x+w,y+h),(0,0,255),2)
30  roi = bin_img[y:y+h,x:x+w]
31  roismall = cv2.resize(roi,(10,10))
32  cv2.imshow('roismall',roismall)
33  cv2.waitKey(10)
34 
35  responses.append(int(num_dir))
36  #print(int(num/10))
37  sample = roismall.reshape((1,100))
38  samples = np.append(samples,sample,0)
39 
40  #cv2.imshow('img',img)
41  #cv2.waitKey(0)
42 
43  num = num+1
44  num_dir = num_dir+1
45 
46 responses = np.array(responses,np.float32)
47 responses = responses.reshape((responses.size,1))
48 print("training complete")
49 
50 np.savetxt('/root/catkin_ws/src/ocr/dataset/generalsamples.data',samples)
51 np.savetxt('/root/catkin_ws/src/ocr/dataset/generalresponses.data',responses)
52 
53 cv2.destroyAllWindows()
